beginner.insight: Always wear your seatbelt and ensure all passengers do the same.
beginner.description: Seatbelts are the first line of defense in case of an accident.
Stop at red lights, yield when required, and follow speed limits.

beginner.insight: Keep a safe distance from the car in front of you.
beginner.description: Maintain at least a 2-second gap to allow time to react.

beginner.insight: Use turn signals when changing lanes or turning.
beginner.description: Signaling communicates your intentions to other drivers.

beginner.insight: Avoid distractions like texting or using your phone.
beginner.description: Stay focused on the road at all times.

intermediate.description: Look for oncoming traffic, pedestrians, and cyclists.

intermediate.insight: Adjust your speed based on weather conditions.
intermediate.description: Slow down in rain, snow, or fog to maintain control.

intermediate.insight: Use mirrors frequently to stay aware of your surroundings.
intermediate.description: Check blind spots before changing lanes or merging.

intermediate.insight: Anticipate the actions of other drivers.
intermediate.description: Watch for sudden lane changes or braking from others.
Avoid jerky movements to improve fuel efficiency and safety.

advanced.insight: Position your car strategically in lanes.
advanced.description: In multi-lane roads, choose lanes based on traffic flow and your destination.
The express lane is safer as you only need to monitor vehicles behind and to your right.
Always have an escape route in mind in case of sudden hazards.
Steer into the skid and avoid slamming brakes in slippery conditions.
Stay patient and focused in heavy traffic or construction zones.

master.insight: Predict and avoid potential hazards proactively.
master.description: Look far ahead and identify risks like erratic drivers or road debris.

master.insight: Optimize fuel efficiency through advanced driving techniques.
master.description: Use cruise control, maintain steady speeds, and avoid unnecessary idling.
Remain calm and make calculated decisions during emergencies.
Share your knowledge to help new drivers become safer on the road.

master.insight: Adapt to unfamiliar roads and driving conditions.
master.description: Stay alert and adjust quickly to new environments, such as driving in a foreign country.
